definition: to put poison in sth/to poison
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
poison/to poison/poisonous/malicious/cruel/fierce/narcotics
to attack murderously/to strike treacherously

sentences.english: The leadership of North Korea could be a poisoned chalice.
sentences.chinese: 朝鮮領導層有點像一隻被下毒的聖盃。

sentences.english: Taste the food before the King eats to make sure it's not poisoned.
sentences.chinese: 在國王用餐之前先嚐嘗食物，確信飯菜沒有被下毒。

sentences.english: As the wine was often full of sediment, a poison could be easily slipped into it.
sentences.chinese: 紅酒中有許多沉澱物，很容易被下毒。

sentences.english: During the reign of King Henry VIII it was a punishment especially reserved for poisoners.
sentences.chinese: 在亨利三世統治時期，這是專爲下毒的犯人準備的。

sentences.english: He is the sort of man to stab you in the back.
sentences.chinese: 他是那種會在背後給你下毒手的人。

sentences.english: Winston, if I were your wife I'd put poison in your coffee.
sentences.chinese: 溫斯頓，如果我是你老婆，就會在你咖啡裏下毒。

sentences.english: In desperation, he decided to throw the helve after the hatchet, in tribute tea against Hu poisoned.
sentences.chinese: 情急之下，他決定孤注一擲，在貢茶裏下毒陷害胡家。

sentences.english: Mingming later meets Jiahui and forces her to poison Jinsheng.
sentences.chinese: 其後，明明再與嘉惠會面，並威逼她向金生下毒。

sentences.english: You miss himself since have been poisoned, who is good-bye Yi's believing him the person who puts poison in?
sentences.chinese: 你想他自己既已中毒，誰再會疑信他就是下毒的人？

sentences.english: He said the new poaching method, poisoning water holes, was incomprehensible in its cruelty.
sentences.chinese: 他說，在水坑下毒這種新盜獵方法的殘忍令人費解。

sentences.english: The God of our fathers hath raised up Jesus, whom you put to death, hanging him upon a tree.
sentences.chinese: 我們祖先的天主復活了你們下毒手懸在木架上的耶穌。

sentences.english: Winston, if I were your wife I’d put poison in your coffee.
sentences.chinese: 溫斯頓，如果我是你老婆，就會在你咖啡裏下毒。

sentences.english: British Royals are apparently never served shellfish, because of a fear of food poisoning.
sentences.chinese: 皇室成員不喫貝殼類水生物，因爲怕下毒。

sentences.english: But zina unwilling, her sister, let her secretly notice to miserably.
sentences.chinese: 可吉娜不甘心，她暗中通知姐姐，讓她去下毒手了。

sentences.english: Paolo admits that he poisoned the doge.
sentences.chinese: 保羅承認是他下毒謀害總督。

definition: to prescribe medicine/to poison/to slip a drug (into sb's drink etc)
to kill by poisoning
to kill secretly/to stab in the back
to conspire to murder/to plot against sb's life
to impute/to shift the blame onto someone else
to entrap/to set up/to frame (up)/to make false charges against
to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
poison
to assassinate/to commit a murder
to kill sb to prevent them from divulging a secret/to silence sb
knockout drops/incapacitating agent/Mickey Finn
to kill/to cause death/to do sb to death
to attack murderously/to strike treacherously
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
to plot against
to assassinate/(military) to fight with a bayonet/(baseball) to put out (a baserunner)
